| HistoryText             = According to [[Herbert Wyndham (Warp World) (Earth-616)|Herbert Wyndham]], the Covenant were a group of atheistic extremists. They scaled [[Wundagore Mountain|Mount Wundagore]] to approach the occult cult named the [[Evolutionaries (Warp World) (Earth-616)|Evolutionaries]]. Deeming the Covenant as a threat to their lifestlye, Wyndham dispatched [[Laura Kinney (Warp World) (Earth-616)|Weapon Hex]] and [[Hellhound (Warp World) (Earth-616)|Hellhound]] to intercept and neutralize the invaders. They were successful and killed the entirety of the Covenant.

Six months later, when Weapon Hex rebelled against Wyndham, she used magic to summon the vengeful spirits of those who died as a result of his actions, including the Covenant. The spirits mauled Wyndham to death before vanishing.{{r|Infinity Wars: Weapon Hex Vol 1 1}}

| Notes                   = * Aside from [[Elsa Bladestone (Warp World) (Earth-616)|Elsa Bladestone]] being a warp between [[Elsa Bloodstone (Earth-616)|Elsa Bloodstone]] and [[Eric Brooks (Earth-616)|Blade]], the remaining members of the Covenant are not a mix between any two characters. According to [[Infinity Wars: Weapon Hex Vol 1|''Infinity Wars: Weapon Hex'']] co-writer [[Ben Blacker]], the script simply said "vampire versions of Covenant members Murderous Lion, Menace, and Jefferson Chambers."{{r|{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/BenBlacker/status/1111031696365780992|title=Ben Blacker on Twitter: "We weren't specific about it. Script just says "vampire versions of Covenant members Murderous Lion, Menace, and Jefferson Chambers."...|work=Twitter|first=Ben|last=Blacker|date=27 March 2019|accessdate=30 March 2019}}}}
